Files | Data Structures | Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
SBL Lib

Files

file  sbl_lib.h
 This file contains the interfaces present in the Secondary Bootloader(SBL) Library. This also contains some related macros, structures and enums.

Macros

#define SBLLIB_MAX_RPRC_IMAGES
 This macro contains the maximum number of RPRC images in multi core App image. For tda3xx, images are: M4-0, M4-1, DSP1, DSP2, EVE1. More...
 
#define SBLLIB_META_HEADER_MAGIC_STR   ((uint32_t) 0x5254534DU)
 This macro contains the magic string to check if multi-core App image is valid(MSTR in ASCII).
 
#define SBLLIB_META_HEADER_MAGIC_END   ((uint32_t) 0x444E454DU)
 This macro contains the magic string to check end of meta header (MEND in ASCII).
 
#define SBLLIB_RPRC_MAGIC_STRING   ((uint32_t) 0x43525052U)
 This macro contains the magic string to check sanity of RPRC image.
 
#define SBLLIB_SOC_L3_IPU1_RAM_BASE   ((uint32_t) 0x58820000U)
 This macro contains the IPU1's internal RAM base address as accessed from L3's(SOC) view.

int32_t SBLLibMultiCoreImageParseV1 (sbllibAppImageParseParams_t *imageParams)
 This function parses the multi-core App image version V1. It reads image header and check for valid AppImage. Device Id field confirms the boot device ID. Then it parses the meta header and finds the number of executables. It first copies the individual RPRC image to DDR memory and then parses and loads the different sections into CPU memory and internal memory. More...
 
int32_t SBLLibMultiCoreImageParseV2 (sbllibAppImageParseParams_t *imageParams)
 This function parses the multi-core App image version V2. It reads image header and check for valid AppImage. Device Id field confirms the boot device ID. Then it parses the meta header and finds the number of executables. It first copies the individual RPRC image to DDR memory and then parses and loads the different sections into CPU memory and internal memory. More...

SBL Lib DDR Type Info

Defines the DDR type parameter.

#define SBLLIB_DDR_TYPE_INVALID   (-1)
 This macro defines the value of DDR type as Invalid.
 
#define SBLLIB_DDR_TYPE_DDR3   (0)
 This macro defines the value of DDR type as DDR3.
 
#define SBLLIB_DDR_TYPE_DDR2   (1)
 This macro defines the value of DDR type as DDR3.
 
#define SBLLIB_DDR_TYPE_LPDDR2   (2)
 This macro defines the value of DDR type as LPDDR2.
 

SBL Lib DDR Speed Info

Defines the DDR speed parameter.

#define SBLLIB_DDR_SPEED_INVALID   (-1)
 This macro defines the value of DDR speed as Invalid.
 
#define SBLLIB_DDR_SPEED_532MHZ   (0)
 This macro defines the value of DDR speed as 532 MHz.
 
#define SBLLIB_DDR_SPEED_400MHZ   (1)
 This macro defines the value of DDR speed as 400 MHz.

 This macro defines the value of DDR speed as 333 MHz.

 This macro defines the value of DDR speed as 666 MHz.

Value:
(SBLLIB_MAX_MPU_CORES + \
SBLLIB_MAX_IPU_CORES + \
SBLLIB_MAX_DSP_CORES + \
SBLLIB_MAX_EVE_CORES)
SBLLIB_MAX_MPU_CORES
#define SBLLIB_MAX_MPU_CORES
This macro contains the maximum number of MPU cores where each dual core MPU subsystem is counted as ...
Definition: sbl_lib_tda2xx.h:75
SBLLIB_MAX_IPU_CORES
#define SBLLIB_MAX_IPU_CORES
This macro contains the maximum number of M4 cores in the system.
Definition: sbl_lib_tda2xx.h:81

#define SBLLIB_MAX_EVE_CORES
This macro contains the maximum number of EVE cores.
Definition: sbl_lib_tda2xx.h:98
SBLLIB_MAX_DSP_CORES
#define SBLLIB_MAX_DSP_CORES
This macro contains the maximum number of DSP cores.
Definition: sbl_lib_tda2xx.h:89

This macro contains the maximum number of RPRC images in multi core App image. For tda3xx, images are: M4-0, M4-1, DSP1, DSP2, EVE1.

typedef struct sbllibRPRCImageHeader sbllibRPRCImageHeader_t

This structure contains the all individual headers required for the RPRC header of multi-core app image.

Note
This has only one instance of RPRC header.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum sbllibBootMode

Enum to select the SBL's Boot Mode.

Enumerator
SBLLIB_BOOT_MODE_QSPI 

SBL's QSPI Boot mode.

SBLLIB_BOOT_MODE_SD 

SBL's SD Boot mode.

SBLLIB_BOOT_MODE_NOR 

SBL's NOR Boot mode.

SBLLIB_BOOT_MODE_QSPI_SD 

SBL's QSPI SD Boot mode.

enum sbllibPrcmDpllOpp

Enum to select the operating point(OPP) for which DPLL should be configured.

Enumerator
SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_LOW 

DPLL Operating Point Low

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_MIN 

DPLL Operating Point Min

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_NOM 

DPLL Operating Point NOM

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_OD 

DPLL Operating Point OD

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_HIGH 

DPLL Operating Point HIGH

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_PLUS 

DPLL Operating Point HIGH

SBLLIB_PRCM_DPLL_OPP_MAX 

Maximum number of opp indices

enum sbllibSblBuildMode

Enum to select the SBL's Build Mode.

Enumerator
SBLLIB_SBL_BUILD_MODE_PROD 

SBL's build mode is production. In production build mode, the slave core is put in a low power state (normally PD_OFF) when the Multi-core Application does not have Image for that particular core.

SBLLIB_SBL_BUILD_MODE_DEV 

SBL's build mode is development. In development build mode, the slave core is brought out of reset even when the Multi-core Application does not have Image for that particular core.

enum sbllibTraceLevel

Enum to select the Trace Level. Prints with ERROR and IMP_INFO are not masked and other prints are masked depending on SBL optimization level.

Enumerator
SBLLIB_TRACE_LEVEL_ERROR 

Trace Level Error: Used for error/warning messages

SBLLIB_TRACE_LEVEL_IMP_INFO 

Trace Level Imp Info: Used for important information

SBLLIB_TRACE_LEVEL_INFO 

Trace Level Info: Used for additional information

SBLLIB_TRACE_LEVEL_INFO1 

Trace Level Info1: Used for additional information (sub level 1)

SBLLIB_TRACE_LEVEL_DEBUG 

Trace Level Debug: Used for debug information

void SBLLibCPUReset ( uint32_t  cpuId)

This function first asserts the both CPU and sub-system resets of slave core and de-asserts the sub-system reset.

Parameters
cpuIdCPU ID of CPU that is to be reset. Refer to enum sbllibCoreId_t for values.
Returns
None.
Note
Valid CPU IDs depend on slave cores present in SoC. This API can't be used for slave IPU cores in case of TDA2xx SOC family.

uint32_t SBLLibEVEGetVecTablePageMask ( void  )

This function returns the EVE vector table page mask that is used to derive the vector table address from the entry point.

The implementation in this library return 0xFF000000U which means that the vector table has been placed at the beginning of a 16MB page that the entry point is located. This is the default behavior of sbl_lib.

However, the implementation in this library is a weak function definition (see src/sbl_lib_weak.c). User application could re-define this function in their own code as a strong definition (i.e. without "weak" function attribute) to override the weak function in this library.

If overridden, one possible valid return value is 0xFFF00000U, which means that the vector table has been placed at the beginning of an 1MB page that the entry point is located. This could potentially be used to reduce the memory footprint. For example, vector tables of 4 EVEs need to be placed at the beginnings of 4 different 16MB pages by default, with this override, they can be placed at the beginnings of 4 different 1MB pages. Of course, user application needs to ensure that the vector table and the entry point are located in the same 1MB page. This can be arranged by exlicit memory placement or linker command file: SECTIONS { .entry_point_page {

  • (.vecs)
  • (.text:_c_int00) } align = 0x100000 > EVE_VECS_MEM PAGE 1 }
Returns
EVE vector table page mask.
char SBLLibGetc ( void  )

This function return a character.

char from console

This function provides the device Id of SoC as defined in SBL Lib.

Returns
deviceId Device Id of SoC
Note
This can be different from the actual device Id of SoC.
int32_t SBLLibGetDpllStructure ( uint32_t  dpllId,
uint32_t  sysClk,
uint32_t  opp,
pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t **  dpllCfg 
)

This function gets the DPLL structure for configuring a particular DPLL depending on the SysClk and OPP.

Parameters
dpllIdDPLL instance for which structure should be fetched. Refer enum pmhalPrcmNodeId_t.
sysClkSystem Clock Frequency. Refer enum pmhalPrcmSysClkVal_t for values.
oppOPP that should be set. Refer enum sbllibPrcmDpllOpp_t for details.
dpllCfgPointer to DPLL structure pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t.
Returns
status Whether DPLL structure is fetched correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
Note
For tda3xx, this API supports only 20 MHz SYSCLK & Opp NOM.

static void SBLLibInitParamsInit ( sbllibInitParams_t *  sbllibInitPrms)
inlinestatic

This API initializes the default parameters for SBL Lib.

Parameters
sbllibInitPrmsSBL Lib Initialization parameters.
Returns
None.
int32_t SBLLibMultiCoreImageParseV1 ( sbllibAppImageParseParams_t *  imageParams)

This function parses the multi-core App image version V1. It reads image header and check for valid AppImage. Device Id field confirms the boot device ID. Then it parses the meta header and finds the number of executables. It first copies the individual RPRC image to DDR memory and then parses and loads the different sections into CPU memory and internal memory.

Parameters
imageParamsMulti-core Application Image Parse Parameters. Refer struct sbllibAppImageParseParams_t for details.
Returns
status Whether image is parsed and copied correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
int32_t SBLLibMultiCoreImageParseV2 ( sbllibAppImageParseParams_t *  imageParams)

This function parses the multi-core App image version V2. It reads image header and check for valid AppImage. Device Id field confirms the boot device ID. Then it parses the meta header and finds the number of executables. It first copies the individual RPRC image to DDR memory and then parses and loads the different sections into CPU memory and internal memory.

Parameters
imageParamsMulti-core Application Image Parse Parameters. Refer struct sbllibAppImageParseParams_t for details.
Returns
status Whether image is parsed and copied correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
void SBLLibPrintf ( uint32_t  traceLevel,
const char *  message 
)

This function prints the message depending on Trace Level. It uses print function registered while doing SBL Lib Initialization.

Parameters
traceLevelUART trace level. Refer enum sbllibTraceLevel_t for details.
messageMessage to be printed on UART console
Returns
None
void SBLLibPrintHexNum ( uint32_t  traceLevel,
uint32_t  value 
)

This function prints hex.

Parameters
traceLevelUART trace level.
valueHex value to be printed
Returns
None
void SBLLibPutc ( uint32_t  traceLevel,
uint8_t  value 
)

This function prints a character.

Parameters

int32_t SBLLibRegisterImageCopyCallback ( SBLLibMediaReadFxn  mediaReadFxn,
SBLLibDDRReadFxn  ddrReadFxn,
SBLLibSeekFxn  seekFxn 
)

This function registers the image copy callback functions which are used while parsing and copying multi-core App image.

Parameters
mediaReadFxnFunction for reading data block from boot media
ddrReadFxnFunction for reading data block from DDR
seekFxnFunction for moving read head
Returns
status Whether call back functions are assigned correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
void SBLLibResetAllSlaveCores ( void  )

This function reset all the slave cores of the SoC. The number of slave cores depends on the SoC.

Returns
None.
Note
On tda3xx slave cores are DSP1, DSP2 and EVE1 (or only EVE)
int32_t SBLLibRprcImageParse ( sbllibRPRCImageHeader_t *  rprcHeader,
const void *  rprcImageAddr,
uint32_t *  entryPoint,
uint32_t  coreId,
uint32_t  isImageInDDR 
)

This function parses the RPRC executable image and copies the individual section into destination location.

Parameters
rprcHeaderHeader of RPRC Image Refer struct sbllibRPRCImageHeader_t for details.
rprcImageAddrAddress of RPRC Image
entryPointCPU entry point location
coreIdCPU ID to identify Core. Refer enum sbllibCoreId_t for values.
isImageInDDRSet to 1 if RPRC image is already in DDR. This will enforce use of gMediaReadFxn instead of gDDRReadFxn
Returns
status Whether image is parsed and copied correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
Note
Valid CPU IDs depend on slave cores present in SoC. When this API is called current RPRC read address is equal to RPRC image start address.
